text: so how can I get better at resisting
temptation
well there's research that suggests a
few simple tricks might make a big
difference
experts from Cornell University in the
United States have done some absolutely
fascinating research looking at the
links between our weight and the foods
we leave lying out on the surface and
based on studies in hundreds of kitchens
they have come up with some golden rules
of what to do and what not to do
[Music]
first put all food out of sight apart
from fruit what the experts found was
that people weighed more on average if
they kept things like biscuits fizzy
drinks crisps and even cereal on their
kitchen counters whereas those were just
fruit on the counter were more likely to
weigh less the trick here is to avoid
temptation altogether so what I'm doing
is out of sight and out of mind but in
reality I am such a chocoholic that I
would actually have to give this to my
wife to hide otherwise I would go and
eat it next reorder your cupboards it
turns out we're all naturally a bit lazy
and are three times more likely to eat
the first food we see than the fifth one
so put healthier foods first and take
vegetables out of the drawers at the
bottom of the fridge and put them where
you can see them
then there's the eating itself
when I cook a family meal like a
casserole I would normally leave it on
the kitchen table for people to help
themselves well it turns out this is
actually a really bad idea in studies
they found that if you leave the
casserole on the stove then people will
actually eat 20% less why well we don't
defeat when we're hungry we eat what is
in front of us so if you leave it over
there then people are far less likely to
help themselves to unnecessary seconds
or even thirds the trick is to
understand that we naturally tend to go
for the easy option and make that the
healthy option
you
